items.title: Afghan whose details were in UK data breach at risk from Taliban if deported, son tells BBC
items.description: Documents seen by the BBC suggest he was part of a special forces unit who worked with the British in Afghanistan.

items.title: 'It's coming home' - the undignified row over the body of Zambia's ex-president
items.description: Edgar Lungu, who died in June, is yet to be buried - the debate over what next exposes deep divisions.

items.title: In maps: The war-ravaged Ukrainian territories at the heart of the Trump-Putin summit
items.description: Kyiv has rejected ceding territory seized by Russia to secure a ceasefire.

items.title: Global plastic talks collapse as countries remain deeply divided
items.description: The latest round of UN-led talks have ended in deadlock, with disputes over plastic production and recycling.

items.title: Suspected French spy arrested in alleged Mali coup plot
items.description: The French national is accused of working "on behalf of the French intelligence service" in Mali.
